definition: BWH, abbr. for a woman's three measurements, namely: bust 胸圍|胸围[xiong1 wei2], waist 腰圍|腰围[yao1 wei2] and hip 臀圍|臀围[tun2 wei2]
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
pedophile (slang, referring to the case of a Hong Kong child abductor who lured girls with the prospect of seeing "goldfish" in his apartment)
head-and-shoulders photo (esp. a formal one used in a passport, ID card etc)
lit. like a little bird relying on people (idiom)/fig. cute and helpless-looking
to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
